1.verse_text: The oracle (a burdensome message—a pronouncement from God) concerning Nineveh [the capital city of Assyria]. The book of the vision of Nahum of Elkosh [which he saw in spirit and prophesied]. The L ord avenges and He is full of wrath. The L ord takes vengeance on His adversaries, And He reserves wrath for His enemies. And He will by no means leave the guilty unpunished. The L ord has His way in the whirlwind and in the storm, And the clouds are the dust beneath His feet. He dries up all the rivers [illustrating His judgment]. Bashan [on the east] and [Mount] Carmel [on the west] wither, And [in the north] the blossoms of Lebanon fade. And the hills melt away; Indeed the earth is shaken by His presence— Yes, the world and all that dwell in it. And who can stand up and endure the fierceness of His anger? His wrath is poured out like fire And the rocks are destroyed by Him. A strength and stronghold in the day of trouble; He knows [He recognizes, cares for, and understands fully] those who take refuge and trust in Him. And will pursue His enemies into darkness. He will make a complete end of it; Affliction [of God’s people by the hand of Assyria] will not occur twice. And like those drowned in drunkenness, Like stubble completely withered and dry [in the day of the L ord ’ s wrath]. One has gone forth who plotted evil against the L ord , “Though they are at full strength and many in number, Even so, they will be cut off and pass away. Though I have afflicted you and caused you grief [O Jerusalem], I will afflict you no longer. And I will tear off your shackles.” “Your name will no longer be perpetuated. I will cut off the carved idols and cast images From the temple of your gods; I will prepare your grave, For you are vile and unworthy.” Who announces peace and prosperity! Celebrate your feasts, O Judah; Perform your vows. For the wicked one [the king of Assyria] will never again pass through you; He is completely cut off.
The L ord is a jealous and avenging God [protecting and demanding what is rightfully and uniquely His];
The L ord is slow to anger and great in power
He rebukes the sea and dries it up;
Who can stand before His indignation [His great wrath]?

But with an overwhelming flood [of judgment through invading armies] He will make a complete destruction of its site The people of Nineveh are consumed [through fire] A malevolent counselor [the king of Assyria].
Whatever [plot] you [Assyrians] devise against the L ord ,
Like tangled thorn branches [gathered for fuel],
This is what the L ord says,
Now, I will break his yoke [of taxation] off you,
The L ord has given a command concerning you [O king of Nineveh]:
Behold, on the mountains the feet of him who brings good news [telling of Assyria’s destruction],

2.verse_text: The one who scatters has come up against you [Nineveh]. Man the fortress and ramparts, watch the road; Like the splendor of [ancient and united] Israel, Even though destroyers have destroyed them And ruined their vine branches. The warriors are dressed in scarlet. The chariots blaze with fire of [flashing] steel When he is prepared to march, And the cypress spears are brandished [for battle]. They rush wildly in the broad plazas. Their appearance is like torches; They rush in various directions like forked lightning. They stumble in their march [terrified because of the attack]. They hurry to the city wall, And the palace [of sun-dried brick] is dissolved [by the torrents]. Nineveh is stripped, and she is carried away, And her handmaids are moaning like the sound of doves, Beating on their breasts [in sorrow]. Now her inhabitants are fleeing; “Stop! Stop!” [a few cry,] But no one turns back. Plunder the gold! For there is no end to the treasure— Wealth from every precious object. Hearts melting [in fear] and knees knocking! Anguish is in the whole body, And the faces of all grow pale! And the feeding place of the young lions, Where the lion, lioness, and lion’s cub prowled With nothing to fear? Killed [enough prey] for his lionesses, And filled his lairs with prey And his dens with torn flesh. Strengthen your back [prepare for battle], summon all your strength. And the mantelet is prepared and firmly set up.
For the L ord will restore the splendor and majesty of Jacob
The shields of his soldiers [of Media and Babylon] are colored red;
The chariots race madly in the streets;
He remembers and summons his nobles;
The gates of the rivers [surrounding Nineveh] are opened
Though Nineveh was like a pool of water throughout her days,
She is emptied! She is desolate and waste!
Where is the den of the lions (Assyria)
The lion [of Assyria] tore enough for his cubs (Assyrian citizens),

“Behold, I am against you [Nineveh],” declares the L ord of hosts, “and I will burn your chariots in the smoke, and the sword will devour your young lions. I will cut off your prey from the land, and the voice of your messengers will no longer be heard.”

3.verse_text: Woe (judgment is coming) to the city of blood [guilty of murder and mayhem], completely full of lies and pillage; Her prey never departs [alive]. The noise of the rattling of the wheel, Galloping horses And rumbling and bounding chariots [in the assault of Nineveh]! Swords flashing, spears gleaming, Many slain, a mass of corpses, No end of corpses— The horsemen stumble over the corpses! The charming and well-favored one, the mistress of sorceries, Who betrays nations by her acts of prostitution (idolatry) And families by her sorceries. “And I will lift up your skirts over your face, And I will let the nations look at your nakedness [O Nineveh] And the kingdoms at your disgrace. And make you vile and treat you with contempt, And set you up as a spectacle. Will shrink back and run from you and say, ‘Nineveh is completely ruined! Who will grieve for her?’ Where will I seek comforters for you?” Which was situated by the waters of the Nile, With water surrounding her, Whose defense was the sea (the Nile), Whose wall consisted of the sea? And Egypt too, without limits. She went into captivity. Her young children were dashed to pieces At the head of every street; They cast lots for her honorable men, And all her great men were bound with chains. You will be hidden. You too [Nineveh] will search [in vain] for a refuge from the enemy. When shaken they fall into the mouth of the eater. The gates of your land are opened wide to your enemies; Fire consumes the bars across your gates. Strengthen your fortresses! Go down to the clay pits, trample the mortar! Prepare the brick kiln [to burn bricks for the rampart]! The sword will cut you down; It will devour you as the locust does. M ultiply yourself like the creeping locusts; Multiply yourself like the swarming locusts. The creeping locust strips and destroys and then flies away. Your marshals are like the hordes of grasshoppers Settling in the stone walls on a cold day. When the sun rises, they fly away, And no one knows the place where they are. Your nobles are lying down [in death]. Your people are scattered on the mountains And there is no one to gather them. Your wound is incurable. All who hear the news about you Clap their hands over [what has happened to] you. For on whom has your [unceasing] evil not come continually?
The noise of the [cracking of the] whip,
All because of the many acts of prostitution of [Nineveh] the prostitute,
“Behold, I am against you,” declares the L ord of hosts,
I will throw filth on you
And it will come about that all who see you
Ethiopia was her strength, Put and Lubim were among her helpers.
You too [Nineveh] will become drunk [with the cup of God’s wrath];
All your fortresses are [nothing but] fig trees with ripe figs—
Behold, your people are [as weak and helpless as] women in your midst!
Draw water for a [long, continued] siege!
But there [in the very midst of these preparations] the fire will devour you;
You have increased your traders more than the [visible] stars of heaven—
Your guardsmen are like the swarming locusts.
Your shepherds are asleep, O king of Assyria;
There is no relief and healing for your hurt;
